item.description:
Every year, the Greater Worcester Humanists get together, welcoming members from all the other local secular groups to get some sun and have a cookout!  They have burgers, hot dogs, veggie burgers for the morally superior, and lots of side dishes and wonderful desserts from the membership's fine chefs. 

Then, once we're all plump and satisfied, there's more time to get some sun and play outside. We have lively sessions of volleyball, frisbee, cricket, and whatever else we an find enough people to play. or, you can just sit back, soak it all in, and chat with friends. 

This year's outing will be a special Father's Day event at a new location - Green Hill Park in Worcester, on Sunday, June 19th from noon to four.  The organizers would love for you to bring your whole family, whether you are a dad, you bring along your dad, or a special dad in your life. This is also kid-friendly event, so bring them along!

This event is free and open to members and non-members alike. This is also a great introductory event so feel free to invite that guy in the office who always asks about Humanism/Atheism, or that friend who's been talking about wanting to hit a meeting. 

 

More information at http://www.meetup.com/worcesterhumanists/events/18120351/.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the folks grilling and chatting!
item.name: Father's Day / Summer Day Out at the Park (with Worcester Humanists)
